title: Toypography
content:
These [clever blocks](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033322/http:/www.kokuyo.co.jp/hiramekitoys/toypography/) in a word can spell the word in English and Japanese and form a picture.

(found via [BoingBoing](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033322/http:/www.boingboing.net/2007/07/08/toypography_blocks_s.html))

 [‹ The story of Monticello](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033322/http:/www.typophile.com/node/32029 "Go to previous forum topic") [Typographic Budapest? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907033322/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34924 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eliason

comments.content:
This is brilliant.

Some of the roman characters that come out of these, while perfectly legible, have some irregularities in form (at the joins, cusps, etc.) I wonder how pure (strictly, hair-splittingly speaking) the characters come out on the Japanese end.
